schemes.benefits: Mentorship and guidance from experts in healthcare, technology, business, and marketing; networking opportunities with investors, partners, and stakeholders; market access support for regulatory navigation and reaching target markets; brand recognition and credibility for selected projects, attracting further investment opportunities.

schemes.schemeName: Industry Innovation Programme on Medical Electronics (IIPME)
schemes.brief: IIPME is a collaborative project between MeitY and BIRAC to fund Indian-led pilot projects in electronics, engineering, medical devices, healthcare, software, algorithms & IT, supporting fast-paced R&D in medical electronics with funding, mentorship, networking, and scaling opportunities across Seed, Early Transition, and Transition to Scale stages.
schemes.eligibilityCriteria: Indian startups less than 3 years old with 51% Indian ownership, Indian LLPs, and entities with DSIR recognition (for early transition & transition to scale) are eligible to apply.
schemes.quantum: Seed Grants: Up to Rs. 50 lakhs for 18 months; Early Transition: Mix of grant & loan not exceeding Rs. 100 lakhs for 24 months; Transition to Scale: Mix of grant & loan for 24-36 months with project cost matched equally by government and industry.
schemes.benefits: Mentorship and guidance from experts in medical electronics; networking opportunities with investors, partners, and stakeholders; validation and credibility from IIPME selection; access to research facilities and equipment at incubators and partner institutions.

departmentName: National Bank for Agriculture and Rural Development (NABARD)

schemes.brief: NABVENTURES is a venture growth equity fund investing in agriculture, food, rural businesses, and agri/rural financial services at early to mid-stage. The fund focuses on asset-light, technology-driven businesses that solve major challenges in agriculture, food, and rural development.
schemes.eligibilityCriteria: Startups registered as private limited companies or LLPs in India in agriculture, agtech, agri-biotech, food, rural fintech, and rural businesses; early to mid-stage ventures with scalable, innovative business models; minimum annual turnover of Rs. 25 lakhs for profit-making companies or positive unit economics for pre-revenue ventures; strong founding team with relevant expertise.
schemes.quantum: Target corpus of Rs. 500 crores (NABVENTURES Fund I) with over Rs. 200 crores committed. Individual investments range from Rs. 5 crores to Rs. 20 crores per venture, with potential for higher amounts based on business potential and stage.
schemes.benefits: Access to equity and equity-linked investments; mentorship and guidance from industry experts; networking opportunities with investors and partners; enhanced brand recognition through NABARD affiliation; assistance with regulatory navigation and market access.

schemes.schemeName: VENTURE CAPITAL FUND FOR SCHEDULED TRIBES (VCF-ST)
schemes.brief: Venture Capital Fund for Scheduled Tribes (VCF-ST) was launched on February 10, 2024, to promote entrepreneurship and support innovative ideas through Technology Business Incubators by providing concessional finance to companies promoted by Scheduled Tribes entrepreneurs.
schemes.eligibilityCriteria: Projects/units in manufacturing, services, and allied sectors, including startups and units incubated in Technology Business Incubators, ensuring asset creation from funds deployed. For assistance up to Rs.50 lakh: companies must have at least 51% shareholding by ST entrepreneurs for past 6 months or be a successor entity of a firm with 51% ST shareholding. For assistance above Rs.50 lakh: companies must have 51% ST shareholding for 12 months or be a successor entity. For technology-oriented innovative projects: Innovative ideas selected by TBIs for incubation funding up to Rs.10 lakh/year for 3 years (aggregate Rs.30 lakh) or new companies with at least 51% ST shareholding working on technology projects with incubation support from premier institutes or approved by government departments.
schemes.quantum: Initial corpus Rs. 21.50 crore, with Rs. 20 crore from Ministry of Tribal Affairs and Rs. 1 crore from Tribal Cooperative Marketing Development Federation of India.
schemes.benefits: Funding assistance from Rs.10 lakh to Rs.5 crore. For Technology Oriented Projects, equity funding up to Rs.30 lakh over 3 years. Coupon: 4% p.a. (3.75% for women/Divyang ST entrepreneurs). Investment period up to 10 years including moratorium up to 36 months.
